snippet: More than 1,000 workers from a Shenzhen site being sold to Lenovo took to the streets in the latest sign of growing labor activism in China.
abstract: More than 1,000 workers go on strike at an IBM factory in Shenzen, China, latest sign of labor activism as companies’ acute shortage of blue-collar workers makes employees increasingly willing to take to the streets; factory is part of deal in which IBM will sell Lenovo its x86 computer server business.
lead_paragraph: More than 1,000 workers from a Shenzhen site being sold to Lenovo took to the streets in the latest sign of growing labor activism in China.

headline.main: Chinese Workers at IBM Factory on Strike Amid Company Sale
headline.print_headline: More Than 1,000 Go on Strike After Sale of IBM Plant in China
